intro: Stachyandra rufibarbis, commonly known as the red-barbed stachyandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive reddish or purple underside, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Stachyandra rufibarbis is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments.
